channel.title: Snoop sometimes showing blank journals when it shouldn't
channel.description:
I've seen this multiple times now, sometimes as Noble myself: A Noble snoops someone who definitely has stuff in their journal, yet it comes up blank. It seems extremely common.
When I encountered this bug, I was later turned, and when I snooped again, it worked, filling out the [i]first[/i] of my two recorded notebooks (so the blank one never ended up getting recorded, not even as a blank notebook.)
Unfortunately, I can't figure out an easy way to reproduce this, but I figured it's worth at least creating a thread so other people can chime in and we can maybe figure out what's causing it.

item.title: Snoop sometimes showing blank journals when it shouldn't
item.dc:creator: Bart_Auringer
item.description:
Just happened in a game I was in. Noble Snooped the Sheriff and Sheriff had “blank logs” only they weren’t blank, Noble just didn’t get them.

Encountered a similar thing first time I played Noble but I assumed he was using Personal Notes. Now, I’m kind of convinced it was just a bug.

item.title: Snoop sometimes showing blank journals when it shouldn't
item.dc:creator: Aquillion
item.description:
Because every time I saw it happen, it was a BD who died shortly afterwards, had a complete log, and insisted they’d always had a complete log even in deadchat / after the game - they had no reason to lie, and a BD has no particular reason to keep their journal in their notes and then copy-paste it in shortly before they die or anything like that.

(The most recent time I saw it, the people involved confirmed it after the game - the Noble saw nothing, and the BD definitely had a log at the time.)
